title: Problem-Based Workshop for [Large-Scale] Workplace Learning and Degree Apprenticeships

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in business administration and leadership experience within organizations
context.additional_context: A course for corporate managers/leaders to strengthen social sector competencies, conducting project-based assessments in digitally equipped environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three common skills required in workplace and academic settings (teamwork, communication, reflection).
Learners can design solutions to real-world workplace problems using Problem-Based Learning (PBL) methodology.
Learners can establish and implement a self-directed learning plan of at least five hours per week through microlearning modules in digital environments.
Learners can develop response strategies for unpredictable situations (e.g., COVID-19) by applying the concept of learning agility.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
